title: [Cloudflare + React 18] ENOENT: no such file or directory, open '../build/server/index.js'
body: Any example project with cloudflare will throw that error upon build
author: tobimori

comments.body:
tried out a bunch of different versions,

using the simple example, 2.8.3+ fails
using the websocket example, any version fails

sometimes different error messages
Ok, so combo is: 2.8.4 + React 18 + Cloudflare doesn't build.
I'm having the same issue with `2.8.3` and `2.8.4`. After downgrading it to `2.8.2` I can successfully run the build.

ğŸ‘‹ Sorry for this, the latest version introduced a side effect, including a React 19 build ğŸ¤¦â€â™‚ï¸

2.8.5 has been released to fix that.

title: Cannot find module error
body:
Hi ğŸ‘‹ğŸ½

## Context of error:
When trying to import the `reactRouterHonoServer` function in my vite.config.ts, I keep getting this error:

`Cannot find module 'react-router-hono-server' or its corresponding type declarations.ts(2307)`

However, in the `package.json` the dependency is listed:

`
  "dependencies": {
      ...,
      "react-router-hono-server": "^2.8.2"
   }
`

## Solutions that I have tried:
1. Deleted node_modules folder and re-installed dependencies.
2. Install manually the dependency "react-router-hono-server".
3. Try with different package managers.

Nevertheless, I keep getting this error, the server does not run and I can't find how to fix it.

Thanks in advance for any help.
author: jayad23

comments.body:
ğŸ‘‹ Did you import it from `"react-router-hono-server/dev"`?

```ts
import { reactRouterHonoServer } from "react-router-hono-server/dev"; // add this
```

title: Suggestion: Add D1 (optional drizzle) example
body:
I have set up D1 and Drizzle all together, it works perfectly fine :octocat: 
I think this is a powerful combo and it should be great to have an `example` of how to implement it

Let me know if a PR would help with this
